info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Iredell and northwestern Rowan Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Statesville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Statesville, Troutman, Cleveland, Lake Norman State Park, Mooresville, Mount Ulla, Cool Springs and Scotts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
